projectGridLines.title: Heat transfer analysis on exhaust gas impingement study on flat plate specimen
projectGridLines.description:
Description: Computational simulations are required to capture the temperature drop across the flat specimen with special coatings

Specific courses required for project execution: Heat Transfer

projectGridLines.title: Point cloud generation for meshfree methods
projectGridLines.description:
Description: Meshfree methods are numerical methods used in CFD simulations which require high performance computing. They work on a cloud of points. General purpose point cloud generators do not exist. This work is intended towards development of methods and necessary code development that can handle very large sized clouds. The work involves working with quadtree, octree and binary trees. Some new methods also need to be examined.

Skill sets: Numerical methods and very good programming skills, high performance and GPU computing.

Expected learning:  Use of HPC and GPU computing, tree based algorithms

Specific courses required for project execution: MSc/M.Tech (maths) or B.Tech (CS)

projectGridLines.title: Development of Metal supported Solid Oxide Fuel Cell
projectGridLines.description:
Description:

Solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) is promising solution for climate crisis. SOFC is known for its high efficiency over other type of fuel cells. Although SOFCs demonstrated excellent performance, the technology suffered because of limited thermal cycling robustness of the ceramic-based cells. In this context, metal-supported SOFCs (M-SOFC) offer a promising alternative to traditional ceramic-supported designs, with advantages including enhanced structural integrity, improved thermal management, reduced operating temperatures, lower manufacturing costs, flexibility in design, and improved resistance to thermal cycling. These characteristics make them attractive for a wide range of applications, including portable and stationary power systems.

Present work focus on fabrication of M-SOFC by a simple cost-effective and industrially viable tapecasting and screen printing routes. Further the fabricated single cells will be systematically characterized for electrical chemical performance. Also the COMSOL simulation will be carried out for flow field analysis to optimize the interconnect design

Skill sets: COMSOL, ANSYS, Solid works experience

Traits expectation: Ability to pursue R&D task, Keen interest, Punctuality & Discipline

Expected learning: Hands on experience on fuel cell fabrication & testing

Specific courses required for project execution: Chemical / Mechanical Engineering

projectGridLines.title: Solid particle erosion resistant coatings for gas turbine compressor blades and their fatigue properties.
projectGridLines.description:
Description: Solid particle erosion is a serious problem faced by gas turbine compressor blades. In order to protect the gas turbine compressor blades from solid particle erosion (SPE), SPE resistant coatings are used. Among these kinds of coatings, nanolayered multi-layered coatings proved to be more efficient. Following that, in CSIR-NAL SPE resistant Ti/TiN, TiCr/TiCrN nanolayered multi-layered coatings are developed on Ti6Al4V substrates using an unbalanced magnetron sputtering system. The present project involves the deposition of these coatings, characterization, erosion tests, and fatigue studies.

Skill sets: The project involves the operation of a magnetron sputtering system for the deposition of solid particle erosion-resistant coatings. Following that, testing of these coatings for their erosion resistance and fatigue properties needs to be carried out

Expected learning: The student will learn the operation of the magnetron sputtering system and sample preparation for fatigue and erosion studies. The student will also learn analysis of FESEM images, nanoindentation, XRD, scratch test, fatigue data and erosion data. In addition, the student will be trained in literature survey, preparation of PPT, and writing reports.

Specific courses required for project execution: No specific courses are needed. However, students with Mechanical and Manufacturing backgrounds are more suitable

projectGridLines.title: Optical properties of nanostructured metallic coatings deposited using cold spray on composite substrates
projectGridLines.description:
Description: Aluminum and other metallic coatings will be prepared on CFRP materials using cold spray process as a possible solution to replace heavy metallic mirrors in harnessing the solar energy for solar thermal applications. Conventionally, large metallic mirrors are used for harnessing solar energy, which become difficult to handle. Cold spray is an upcoming method to depot metallic coatings under non-vacuum conditions and at very low temperatures. CSIR-NAL has expertise in both composite materials and cold spray technology and this project will explore using a non-conventional approach in developing cost effective solutions for preparing reflective coatings. 

 Skill sets:  Basic knowledge of physics and materials science

Traits expectation: Sincere and hard working with an interest to learn new things

Expected learning: To work on novel coating deposition processes and hands on experience on advanced analytical tools such as atomic force microscopy and optical measurement techniques in addition to cold spray technique.

 

Specific courses required for project execution: Training will be imparted to complete the objective of the work.

projectGridLines.title: Development of generative AI model for the design of electromagnetic absorber
projectGridLines.description:
Description: The conventional approach for the design of absorbers involve parametric optimization which in turn require computationally intensive and time consuming simulations. In this regard, deep learning models can be used to automate the entire design process of absorber. State-of-the-art generative DL models will be developed for this purpose.

Skill sets: Programming in Python, Deep learning

Traits expectation: Inquisitiveness, Perseverance, Sense of integrity

Expected learning: Electromagnetic design of absorbers, Generative AI

Specific courses required for project execution: Computer programming, Machine learning

projectGridLines.title: EM design and development of functionally graded radome for X-band applications
projectGridLines.description:
Description: In aerospace sector, conventional composite materials are not suitable for ultra-high temperature applications. This is due to the large temperature gradients that occur during high Mach operations which in turn cause mismatch in the thermal expansion properties of different materials. Functionally gradient materials (FGM) solve this problem by replacing the sharp interfaces with gradient interfaces by gradually varying the properties like permeability, permittivity etc. from one layer to another. In this regard, FGM based radome wall configurations will be designed and developed for X-band applications.

Skill sets: Electromagnetics

Traits expectation: Inquisitiveness, Perseverance, Sense of integrity

Expected learning: EM design of radomes

Specific courses required for project execution: Electromagnetics

projectGridLines.title: Mechanical properties of natural fiber?polymer composites
projectGridLines.description:
Description: Natural fibers will be synthesized by environment-friendly method, characterized by FESEM, FTIR, TGA, and XPS

Skill sets: B. Tech. in Chemical Engineering/ Mechanical Engineering

Traits expectation: General understanding of mechanical properties of natural fiber-polymer composites

Expected learning: Synthesis of natural fiber and its polymer composites, different characterization techniques and their analyses, studies on mechanical properties of composites such as tensile strength and analysis of the results
